intro: Dyschoriste siphonantha var. scandens, commonly known as the climbing dyschoriste, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and climbers. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges. Its small, white to pink flowers are clustered in racemes and bloom during the rainy season. The plant is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and along stream banks.
